article.headline: Portland 92, UC Riverside 74
article.story: PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) -- Pooh Jeter had 20 points, seven rebounds and four assists as Portland won its home opener Sunday, 92-74 over UC Riverside. Portland's starting frontcourt of Donald Wilson, Marcus Lewis and Kevin Field shot 60 percent from the field and scored 44 points as the Pilots played a strong game around the basket. The Pilots (1-2) led by as many 15 points in the first half before settling for a 43-30 lead at the break. But Portland's sluggish start to the second half helped the Highlanders get back into the game. Rickey Porter hit a 3-pointer six minutes into the second half to narrow Portland's lead to 46-44. Wilson, however, answered with his own 3-pointer to extend the lead to five. Moments later, Wilson made a steal and finished the play with a dunk. Later, an 8-0 run by the Pilots, fueled by six Jeter free throws, built the lead to 74-60 and the Highlanders never threatened again. Porter had a game-high 21 points for UC Riverside while teammate Steve Williams added 16. The Highlanders attempted 30 3-pointers, but made only seven.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
